definition: Red Army (1928-1937), predecessor of the PLA/(Soviet) Red Army (1917-1946)
surname Hong
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
(bound form) army/military

sentences.english: 5 the central army, save dared stand up for the reds.
sentences.chinese: 五战中央军，解救红军张敢为。

sentences.english: Lucas Levia would love to play at Wembley for Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 卢卡斯表示，他愿意为红军在温布利球场比赛。

sentences.english: Our Red Army men fought a good battle.
sentences.chinese: 红军战士打了一场漂亮仗。

sentences.english: Snow fell all night on the mountain .
The Red Army's glorious revolutionary traditions have carried over to the present day.
sentences.chinese: 红军的光荣革命传统一直发扬到今天。

sentences.english: Great all- China meetings of Party and Red Army delegates were called in May and June.
sentences.chinese: 党和红军的全国代表大会五月和六月间分别召开了。

sentences.english: It is inappropriate to advocate a "contest of attrition " for the Chinese Red Army today.
sentences.chinese: “拚消耗”的主张，对于中国红军来说是不适时宜的。

sentences.english: Jamie Carragher has talked about a "massive week" approaching for the Reds.
sentences.chinese: 克拉格谈到过对红军来说“至关重要的一周。”

sentences.english: The Reds midfielder is undecided whether he will follow team-mate Jamie Carragher by taking his coaching badges.
sentences.chinese: 红军队长还未决定是否跟随队友卡拉格考取教练证书。

sentences.english: The Red Army men once wrote down their heroic feat here.
sentences.chinese: 中国工农红军也曾在这里的雪山草地里书写壮举。

sentences.english: After that the Red Army work-team went to talk to my father.
sentences.chinese: 之后，红军工作队就去找我父亲谈话。

sentences.english: Both he and Tord Grip gew up supporting the Reds.
sentences.chinese: 他和助手格里普从小都是红军的支持者。

sentences.english: The Red Army arrived in Haldensleben on June 1.
sentences.chinese: 红军在6月1日到达哈尔登斯莱。

sentences.english: Absolute equalitarianism became quite serious in the Red Army at one time.
sentences.chinese: 红军中的绝对平均主义，有一个时期发展得很厉害。

sentences.english: After a time the enemy was baying across all south Kiangsi, hunting for the elusive Reds.
sentences.chinese: 不久以后，敌人就在赣南到处追逐行踪不定的红军。

sentences.english: Because Du Gongjun's son longs for a mother, object Du Gongjun remarrying all the time.
sentences.chinese: 杜红军的儿子因为思念母亲，一直反对杜红军再婚。

definition: He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
nationalist forces
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Jinggangshan county level city in Ji'an 吉安, Jiangxi
Jinggang Mountains, in the Jiangxi-Hunan border region
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
White Guard or White Movement, anti-communist troops fighting against the Bolsheviks during the Russian Civil War (1917-1922)
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
guerrilla band
Guomindang or Kuomintang (KMT)/Nationalist Party
